meanings.definition: Without any basis or foundation; unfounded.
meanings.sent1: The rumor about aliens visiting Earth was groundless.
meanings.sent2: Her fear of spiders was groundless, as they are harmless creatures.
meanings.sent3: Tom's claim that he could fly like a superhero was groundless.
meanings.sent4: The idea of finding a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow is as groundless as believing in fairy tales.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's accusation that the student cheated on the test was groundless and quickly dismissed.

meanings.sent1: The conspiracy theory was groundless and caused unnecessary panic.
meanings.sent2: His argument was groundless, as he failed to provide any supporting facts.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fear of the vacuum cleaner seemed groundless and amusing to the family.
meanings.sent4: The belief that money can buy happiness is as groundless as thinking a band-aid can fix a broken heart.
meanings.sent5: The detective's accusation of the butler being the murderer was groundless and led to a surprising twist in the case.
